computing_and_graphics.context: Includes Ryzen, Radeon, and AMD Instinct processors

drivers: Strong demand for Ryzen 5000 processors in desktops
Increased market share in premium consumer and gaming segments

ryzen_5000.performance_improvement: +19% instructions per clock compared to Zen 2
ryzen_5000.impact: Enhanced performance and energy efficiency leading to higher adoption rates

drivers: Record quarterly and annual mobile processor unit shipments
Increased adoption of Ryzen 5000 mobile processors in notebooks

ryzen_5000_mobile.description: Optimized for ultra-thin gaming in commercial notebooks
ryzen_5000_mobile.impact: Extended performance and battery life leadership in mobile segment
ryzen_5000_mobile.future_plans: Increase notebook designs powered by Ryzen 5000 by 50% compared to prior generation

graphics.context: Revenue more than doubled YoY, increased QoQ
drivers: Ramp of Radeon 6000 series GPUs with RDNA 2 architecture
Strong demand for Radeon 6000 series, fastest selling high-end GPUs
Increased shipments of AMD CDNA 2 data center GPUs

rdna_2.performance_improvement: Up to twice the performance and 65% more performance per watt
rdna_2.future_plans: Expand Radeon 6000 GPU portfolio in the first half of 2021

cdna_2_gpu.performance_improvement: Significant gains in HPC and AI compute performance
cdna_2_gpu.impact: Powering Frontier exascale supercomputer and other HPC applications
cdna_2_gpu.future_outlook: Further deployments in scientific and enterprise environments

enterprise_embedded_and_semi_custom.context: Includes EPYC processors and semi-custom products

drivers: Strong demand for next-generation Sony and Microsoft consoles
Increased ramp of semi-custom SoC sales compared to last console cycle
Higher than typical seasonal sales in Q3 2021
Strong growth in cloud and enterprise adoption
Expansion of EPYC processor deployments by major hyperscalers

milan_processors.description: Third-generation EPYC Milan processors with Zen 3
milan_processors.shipments: Initial shipments to cloud and HPC customers
milan_processors.performance_improvement: 68% better performance compared to high-end dual-socket processors

total_expenses.context: Operating expenses including R&D, go-to-market activities, and higher variable compensation-related expenses

R&D.context: Increased investments in research and development

marketing.context: Enhanced go-to-market activities to support product launches and growth

drivers: Higher Ryzen, EPYC, and semi-custom product sales

eps.context: Non-GAAP diluted earnings per share for Q3 2021

tax_rate.context: Effective tax rate for Q3 2021 and full year 2021

free_cash_flow.context: Generated from operating activities after capital expenditures in Q3 2021

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased more than 7 million shares of common stock for $750 million during Q3 2021

acquisition_of_xilinx.description: Strategic acquisition to enhance high-performance computing and AI solutions
acquisition_of_xilinx.status: On track to close by end of 2021

transaction_structure.share_price: $143 per Xilinx share based on VWAP
transaction_structure.conditions: Required approvals and customary closing conditions

leadership.new_position: Victor (Xilinx CEO) joining AMD as president

zen_3.description: Next-generation Ryzen desktop processors with Zen 3 architecture
zen_3.performance_improvement: +19% instructions per clock compared to Zen 2
zen_3.impact: Absolute performance leadership across gaming, productivity, and creative workloads

rdna_2.performance_improvement: Up to twice the performance and 65% more performance per watt

milan.description: Third-generation EPYC server processors with Zen 3
milan.performance_improvement: 68% better performance compared to high-end dual-socket processors

instinct_mi100.performance: First data center GPU to break the 10 teraflops barrier
instinct_mi100.impact: Fastest HPC accelerator for scientific research

epyc_7003.key_product: EPYC 7763, the world’s highest performance server processor
epyc_7003.performance_improvement: Up to two times better performance in HPC, cloud, and enterprise workloads compared to competition
epyc_7003.impact: Enhances AMD's per-socket and per-core performance leadership

operating_environment_challenges: Meeting strong demand amidst pandemic-related challenges
Maintaining high growth rates in competitive markets

revenue.context: Driven by growth in all businesses, higher server and semi-custom revenue

full_year_2021.context: Driven by growth across all businesses, up from prior guidance of +60%

product_introductions: AMD EPYC 7003 series processors including EPYC 7763
Radeon 6700 XT GPU with RDNA 2 architecture
AMD CDNA 2 data center GPUs powering Frontier supercomputer
partnerships_and_adoptions: Argonne National Labs selected AMD EPYC processors for Polaris supercomputer
Google Cloud announced N2D Virtual Machines powered by AMD EPYC™ 7003 Series processors
Amazon EC2 G4ad instances powered by 2nd Gen AMD EPYC CPUs and Radeon Pro V520 GPUs
Cloudflare chose 3rd Gen AMD EPYC processors for its 11th Gen servers
Microsoft partnered with AMD to enhance Windows 11 with Ryzen processors and Radeon graphics
Lenovo started shipments of Ryzen-based Thinkbook and Thinkpad E series laptops
HP released two AiO devices with Ryzen processors
ASUS unveiled Ryzen 5000 Series-based Zenbook, Zenbook PRO, ProArt StudioBook, and VivoBook
Dell Technologies PowerEdge servers with EPYC 7003
HPE ProLiant and Apollo systems with EPYC 7003
ecosystem_support: HPE and KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Sweden announced a new pre-exascale supercomputer using EPYC and Instinct GPUs
EPYC CPUs and Instinct GPUs powering expanded cloud-based HPC solutions including Siemens NX and PTC Creo on Microsoft Azure NVv4 instances
Over 100 new AMD-powered server platforms announced by Cisco, Dell, HPE, Lenovo, and Supermicro
corporate_responsibility: Investments in sustainable technological and scientific advancements
Support for community initiatives amidst COVID-19
